thread.title: Best pancakes in London for Shrove Tuesday
thread.title_full: Best pancakes in London for Shrove Tuesday

author: Rachael Sigee
title: Best pancakes in London for Shrove Tuesday
text:
Best pancakes in London for Shrove Tuesday 
From the capital's most luxurious offerings to its booziest, Rachael Sigee picks her favourite pancakes in London Thursday 23 February 2017 15:25 GMT Click to followES Going Out Get battered: The Book Club’s stack 
Pancake Day doesn’t seem quite so special now that pancakes are on offer at every other bottomless brunch in town. So next Tuesday take the time to treat yourself to something a little more showbiz than lemon and sugar. Luxe 
A classic pancake batter can be knocked up for pennies but there’s no requirement that Shrove Tuesday be a frugal affair. Make the most of it with fresh lobster, mushrooms and smoked garlic bisque. 
Info: £32, The Botanist, SW1, sloanesquare.thebotanistlondon.com Super-sweet 
Forget pancakes for breakfast and go for an indulgent pudding of deep-fried pancakes with salted caramel rum sauce, banana, whipped cream and Nutella. 
Info: £8.50, The Book Club, EC2, wearetbc.com Homegrown 
Keep things local with foraged ingredients from the Sussex forest — pancakes served up with redcurrant and rose geranium drizzle sauce and hazelnut sherbet. 
Info: £6, Rabbit, SW3, rabbit-restaurant.com The 5 steps to making the perfect pancakes Comfort food 
Curl up and keep cosy with some fluffy ricotta pancakes with poached pear and maple crème fraîche at this new independent restaurant in Richmond. 
Info: £7.50, No 1 Duke Street, Richmond, no1dukestreet.com Boozy
